alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan; Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 12:19PM EDT until July 29 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Bell County in southeastern Kentucky... Southern Harlan County in southeastern Kentucky... Central Knox County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 330 PM EDT. * At 1219 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Barbourville, Harlan, Pineville, Middlesboro, Loyall, Evarts, Wallins Creek, Black Snake, Balkan, Blackmont, Callaway, Pathfork, Molus, Oaks, Cubage, Miracle, Stony Fork Junction, Varilla, Coldiron and Kettle Island. Reports of roadways in Bell County are experiencing high water issues. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
